intro: Odontarrhena pateri subsp. pateri, commonly known as the Pater's odontarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in small inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
